> <OLD>
>
> Tucson had a feeling that Leo wouldnt allow him to go it alone but as Leo
> and the others were catching up to him, he takes things in stride and slows
> his sprint down to a lope and then to a trot before slowing further to a
> walk and then stops.  Something stops him from making a foolish mistake.
> Instead he transforms into robot mode and nods to his comrades.
>
> " Intuition just told me to take a different approach to this situation.
> Something that only Master Yoketron would do at a time like this.  I must
> remember my training, and why I was chosen to undergo such mentor ship ."
>
> He looks to Leo and Big Convoy.
>
> " All right, we still have a bit of a way to go by the sound of things, and
> I think a two phased strategy is better than a one shot deal.  Since I've
> been blind for a long time, I can navigate in darkness rather quickly.  It's
> best you allow me to go ahead and map a way for you to allow easier access
> and cut down on time expansion.  Leo, Big Convoy, I would like the heavier
> Maximals to follow behind with you, and the Maximals who are swift and
> agility based to follow me.  You can chose whoever you deem fits either
> category.  This also holds true for the Predicons assisting in our efforts.
> We have a greater chance at success if we work strategically."

<NEW>

LEO PRIME looked over at BIG CONVOY.

"Yeah, they are all like this in the begining." CONVOY said. "Young
and full of confidence." There was a chuckle from CONVOY, "As the
humans have said, ten foot tall and bullet proof."

Looking back at TUSCON there was a nod from LEO PRIME, "Let's go." He
said as the other MAXIMALS rallied up around them.

As they moved on the tunnel turned abruptly and showed them the
reasoning for the flickering light as the tunnel ended at a ledge, a
ledge that was hundreds of feet from the floor of a vast cavern, the
cieling of which was nearly fifty feet above the top of the tunnel
they had just emerged from. The cavern stretched out for perhaps a
mile or more in diameter and was maybe two or three hundred feet from
floor to cieling.

The cieling itself had large stalactites reaching down perhaps 30 feet
from the cieiling, while there are an equal number of stalagmites
rising from the floor. There is even a sparse type of fungi-like
vegatation down here, although it is different from anything seen on
the surface.

In the center of the chasm, about a mile away from the tunnel entrance
there was a large cylinder of yellow light fire rising from the floor
of the cave and disapearing into a hole in the cieling. It
superficially looked like fire it also had the look of some sort of
energy as sparks crackled and arced all around it.

It is this flickering light that was noticable from the tunnel as the
light itself bathed the cavern.

At the bottom of the the columb of fire was a large black pit and
hanging suspended above it by blackened chains was a tiny figure in
red . . . OPTIMUS PRIME who was being bathed in that very fire!

Although it was difficult to see at nearly a mile distant, the tiny
figures of MAGMATRON and SABERBACK were standing watching. Around them
were arrayed SHARKTICONS and some others that from that distance
appeared to be DINOBOTS or at least something akin to them.

But even at the distance there was a booming chuckle that sounded like
it came from SABERBACK even though he was still merely a mile away!

(TAG)

- Preston
